channel.title: Make Donator Items Only Weildable and Useable to Donators?
channel.description:
I have a spot for donators only that sells donator only items.
HOWEVER.
If someone where to become donator, he/she could buy the items and sell them to friends.
How could I make it so you have to be a donator, or mod/admin, to be able to hold the weapon. So that, even if a regular user has the weapon, he/she cannot use it. When they try to wield it it would say something like "Mofo donate to use this weapon".
Thanks.

item.title: Make Donator Items Only Weildable and Useable to Donators?

item.description:
@hellonearth wrote:

No probs m8

Read full topic

item.title: Make Donator Items Only Weildable and Useable to Donators?
item.dc:creator: @isassi isassi
item.description:
@isassi wrote:

[quote=“hellonearth, post:19, topic:353376”]here is one from a bulby base

[code]if ((wearId == 3101) || (wearId == 1007) || (wearId == 4375) || (wearId == 1121) || (wearId == 13095) || (wearId == 13097) || (wearId == 13099)) {
if ((p.rights < 1) && (p.donator < 1)) {

p.frames.sendMessage(p,“You must become a donator before you can wear this!”);
return;
}
}
[/code]

hope this helped :D[/quote]

Thanks helped alot Rep +

Read full topic

if ((p.rights < 1) && (p.donator < 1)) {

p.frames.sendMessage(p,“You must become a donator before you can wear this!”);
return;

}
[/code]

hope this helped

It works!

Thanks guys!

Orc - For finding where to put it in my Client.java (near the bottom, yes it’s a 317 server) + Code.
Vain - Explaining what was wrong + code.
Jmood - Explaining where to find custom id’s
Ferity - Where to put code + code

I don’t know what I would do without you guys.

item.dc:creator: @orcashark orcashark
item.description:
@orcashark wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:4, topic:353434”][quote author=orcashark link=topic=449701.msg3299431#msg3299431 date=1281193179]

All of that code is horrendous.

Try this:

   if((wearID == ITEM_ID) && donator == 1)
        {
                return true;
        } else {
                sM("Sorry, this item is for donators only.");
                return false;
        }

Ye i know i just took his code and remade it for him.

If you want ill type my own out right now.
[/quote]I doubt you’d type your own.
You’d probably just find one lying around in some source you have.

I typed the one I posted.

I stated his error.

If you wish to help him, find him the wearID method from your server.[/quote]

^^ I just did, and yes i didnt exactly type it out, i just took a thing from my server and replaced the item ids. But i typed most of them out on my own server.

item.title: Make Donator Items Only Weildable and Useable to Donators?
item.dc:creator: @orcashark orcashark
item.description:
@orcashark wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:1, topic:353434”]All of that code is horrendous.

Try this:

if((wearID == ITEM_ID) && donator == 1) { return true; } else { sM("Sorry, this item is for donators only."); return false; } [/quote]

Ye i know i just took his code and remade it for him.

If you want ill type my own out right now.

Here is one i would use for 107 for donors only (You can change to staff if you like)

if(wearID == 107 && donator == 0){ sM("You must be a donator to wear this item."); return false; }

Or you can simply teach them right and use a command that if someone has a certain item id then it just deletes it if they dont have the required player right, ill post that if you really need it

Read full topic

item.source: Make Donator Items Only Weildable and Useable to Donators?

item.title: Make Donator Items Only Weildable and Useable to Donators?
item.dc:creator: @orcashark orcashark
item.description:
@orcashark wrote:

[quote=“Duke Nukem, post:4, topic:353376”][quote author=Ferity link=topic=449701.msg3299121#msg3299121 date=1281165067]
Donator item:

if(wearID == 35 && (donator != 1)) { // donator item; The 35 is the item Id, in my example it's Ags sM("You must be a Donator To Wear This"); return false; }

Staff Item:

if(wearID == 773 && (playerRights != 1)) { // staff item sM("You must be a staff member to wear this"); return false; }

Hope it helped you.
[/quote]

Where do I put that code?[/quote]

That is wrong.

If you use playerRights != 1) that means either only mod can wear it or anyone but mod can wear it (Not too sure right now)

But say you want it to be, Mod+, make it playerRights >= 1)

For the donor one i suggest you use donator == 1)

So both codes would look somewhat like this.

if(wearID == 35 && (donator == 0)) sM("You must be a Donator To Wear This Item"); return false; }

and for staff only it would be

if(wearID == 773 && (playerRights >= 1)) { sM("You must be a staff member to wear this item"); return false; }

Or if you wanted donor AND staff to wear this item simply do this,

if(wearID == 35 && (donator != 1)) || (playerRights >= 1)) { sM("You must be a Donator To Wear This"); return false; }

So basicly i combined both of his commands, whitch are correct, just a simple error with the java, whitch everyone makes every now and then.

This is all for a 317 that i put above.

Duke, you would want to add this toward the bottom of your client.java [IF THIS IS A 317]
You will see other commands laid out just like them, just add it underneath.

Hope this helped!

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ferity Ferity
item.description:
@Ferity wrote:

EDIT: It must be written in Client.java

Donator item:

if(wearID == 35 && (donator != 1)) { // donator item; The 35 is the item Id, in my example it's Ags sM("You must be a Donator To Wear This"); return false; }

Staff Item:

if(wearID == 773 && (playerRights != 1)) { // staff item sM("You must be a staff member to wear this"); return false; }

I’m using Delta.
Hope it helped you.
